articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Russian Orthodox Church Delegation
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Russian Orthodox Church Delegation

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with the Russian Orthodox Church delegation headed by Yegorievsk Archbishop Mark, chairman of the Committee for Coordinating Overseas Institutions of the church who paid a courtesy call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Saturday.

articles.title: Congratulations to Thai FM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Thai FM

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Surapong Towijakchaikul upon his appointment as foreign minister of Thailand.
					
					Expressing belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished him great success in his new job.

articles.title: DPRK Schoolchildren's Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
DPRK Schoolchildren's Delegation Leaves for China

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- A DPRK schoolchildren's delegation led by Ryom Yun Hak, president of the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, left here Saturday to participate in the friendly meeting with international children to be held in Beijing, China.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to President Kim Il Sung

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Chief Jo Il Min and staff members of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front Saturday laid a floral basket before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mt. Ryongnam on the 66th anniversary of Korea's Liberation.
					
					They placed the floral basket before the statue and paid tribute to him in humble reverence, looking back on the immortal and great feats he performed in the history of the movement for Korea's reunification.
					
					On the same day, they laid bunches of flowers before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong.

articles.title: Three Charters for National Reunification Memorial Tower Ten Years Old
articles.content:
Three Charters for National Reunification Memorial Tower Ten Years Old

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The Three Charters for National Reunification Memorial Tower has been visited by an endless stream of people over the last decade since it was unveiled on August 14, 2001.
					
					More than 900 000 servicepersons, people from all walks of life, school youth and children have visited the tower so far. It has drawn over 15 500 overseas compatriots and foreigners from nearly 3 000 organizations. More than 100 000 servicepersons, people from all walks of life, school youth and children, compatriots from south Korea and overseas and foreign guests visited the tower in one year since it was unveiled.

articles.title: Pyongyang Puppet Theatre Crowded by Schoolchildren
articles.content:
Pyongyang Puppet Theatre Crowded by Schoolchildren

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Schoolchildren in Pyongyang frequent the Pyongyang Puppet Theatre in Jonsung-dong, Moranbong District during the summer vacation. 
					
					New puppet shows created by the Pyongyang Puppet Company are performed in the theatre. 
					
					A many-act puppet show "Kind Heart of the Third Son" calls upon children to do good things for society, collective and friends. 
					
					Most popular of the shows are "Ok Soe Defeats Devil", "The Baldheaded Parrot" and "Doggy Plays Cheap Tricks". 
					
					They are conducive to children's intellectual development and cultural life.
					
					August 13 is the golden anniversary of the company.

articles.title: Ryongmae Tideland Reclamation Project Makes Headway
articles.content:
Ryongmae Tideland Reclamation Project Makes Headway

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- A tideland reclamation project has made progress around Rongmae Islet, opposite to the Haeju Bay on the south coast. The islet belongs to South Hwanghae Province.
					
					Since the project was launched in January, the South Hwanghae Provincial Tideland Reclamation Complex moved about 250 000 cubic meters of earth and laid some 76 000 square meters of stones to build up a 2 100 meter-long embankment on the sea.
					
					It was very cold when the project started. But the complex pushed ahead with it, overcoming difficulties. 
					
					It has also applied new reclamation methods suitable to geographical condition of the area.
					
					Recent heavy rainfalls severed roads and bridges there. The builders are working on rebuilding them, while carrying on the project as scheduled through tunneling and blasting.
					
					When the project is finished, a new arable land as large as that of a county will appear on the tideland.

articles.title: Anniversary of Opening of Jongbaek Church Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Opening of Jongbaek Church Observed

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- An event took place on Saturday to mark the fifth anniversary of the opening of Jongbaek Church.
					
					Present there were officials concerned, a Russian Orthodox Church delegation headed by Yegorievsk Archbishop Mark who is chairman of the Committee for Coordinating Overseas Institutions of the church and the Russian ambassador to the DPRK and staff members of the embassy, staff members of foreign embassies and representatives of international organizations here. 
					
					Speeches were made at the event.
					
					The Korean Orthodox Church Committee gave a reception on the same day.

articles.title: Vol. 95 of "Among the People" Off Press
articles.content:
Vol. 95 of "Among the People" Off Press

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Vol. 95 of "Among the People", a collection of reminiscences, was brought out in the DPRK.
					
					The book contains 19 reminiscences dealing with President Kim Il Sung's immortal leadership feats and noble traits.
					
					The book carries reminiscences telling story about how the President kindled the torch for the production of 10 000 machine tools and developed the then Huichon Machine Tool Factory into a mother plant of the DPRK's machine-building industry.
					
					There are in the book reminiscences dealing with the wise leadership of the President who built a solid iron ore production base and paid deep attention to developing the steel industry relying on locally available resources.
					
					The book also contains reminiscences telling stories about what wisdom and energy the President devoted to the settlement of the people's issue of food.
					
					Reminiscences contained in the book deal with the profound loving care shown by the President for bringing the cooking culture into bloom in the country and preparing younger generation as reliable successors to the revolution.
					
					There are also reminiscences recounting stories about how the President made sure that the revolutionary historic sites were preserved with good care and successfully managed and what profound trust he reposed in an ordinary journalist.

articles.title: Tunnel Tactics Employed in Korean War
articles.content:
Tunnel Tactics Employed in Korean War

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung advanced a tunnel tactics in the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953).
					
					One day in late September Juche 40 (1951), the President ordered commanding officers of the Korean People's Army (KPA) to make tunnel-type defense positions in mountains.
					
					In response to his order, army units tunneled heights in the front and coastal areas for defense positions, turning them into impregnable fortresses.
					
					The tunnel warfare proved successful in many battles, including those to defend Height 1211.
					
					When the enemy bombed and shelled the defense positions, KPA soldiers took a rest in tunnels, enjoying songs and dances.
					
					The Juche-based tunnel warfare made it possible to maintain the forces to the utmost in hard-fought battles and frustrate the enemy's offensives.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Great Feats for Korea's Liberation
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Great Feats for Korea's Liberation

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- August 15 marks the anniversary of national liberation won by the Korean people under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					With the day approaching, the Korean people are looking back upon the feats the President performed in putting an end to the 40-odd-year colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists and liberating the country.
					
					Struggle against capitalism and colonial rule ran high in some countries in the late 1920s, a sign of the advent of a new era in the struggle against the class exploitation and national oppression and for independence and the development of the revolution on a worldwide scale.
					
					With a deep insight into subjective and objective requirements of the Korean revolution, the President convened a meeting of cadres of Communist League and Anti-imperialist Youth League in June, Juche 19 (1930). At the meeting, he put forward a unique revolutionary theory that one should be responsible for all problems arising in waging revolution and tackle them independently in conformity with the actual situation of the country.
					
					He defined an organized armed struggle as a fundamental way for the movement of national liberation in colony and called for providing all necessary conditions for the movement.
					
					After training hardcore members, preparing arms, gaining military experience and laying mass foundation, he founded revolutionary armed forces in April 1932. 
					
					In historic meetings held in Dahuangwai, Nanhutou and Nanpaizi, he set forth strategic and tactical tasks and ways for successfully advancing the anti-Japanese national liberation struggle.
					
					Under difficult circumstances, he employed superb tactics in battles.
					
					Many stories praising the President as a legendary hero of the anti-Japanese armed struggle are well known among the Korean people.
					
					Under the slogan "Oppose armed force with armed force, and resist counterrevolutionary violence with revolutionary violence!" he defeated the Japanese imperialists and achieved the country's liberation.
					
					The victory in the anti-Japanese armed struggle served as a landmark event that inspired the world's oppressed people to the struggle for national liberation and put the revolutionary movement on a higher stage.

articles.title: Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration Called for
articles.content:
Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration Called for

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The workers vanguard for reunification of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally for peace and reunification in South Kyongsang Province on August 9 at which it called for implementing the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					Speakers at the rally said that it has waged a positive movement to implement the joint declaration and dynamically struggled to defend peace on this land from all war threats.
					
					But the present conservative authorities have pursued confrontation policies including "no nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars" in total denial of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration since the very day of their office, driving the inter-Korean relations to the worst crisis, they charged.
					
					Always invariable are the will and desire of the people to oppose war and achieve the independent reunification of the country, they noted.
					
					They demanded the "government" stop the act of going against the ardent desire of the nation for reunification and thoroughly implement the June 15 joint declaration, though belatedly.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Achieving Independent Reunification of Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Achieving Independent Reunification of Korea

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The inter-Korean relations still remain at the lowest ebb due to the south Korean authorities' policy for confrontation with fellow countrymen. It is necessary for all the Koreans to pick up the nationwide desire for reunification with the conviction of victory in the cause of national reunification with August 15 as a momentum. 
					
					Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					It goes on:
					
					Whoever wants the country's reunification and the nation's prosperity should firmly defend the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and creditably discharge responsibility and duty as a member of the nation in the struggle for implementing them.
					
					All the Koreans should closely unite under the banner of "By our nation itself" irrespective of ideology, system, political view and ism and reinforce the driving force for national reunification. 
					
					Political parties, organizations and compatriots from all walks of life at home and abroad should support and keep pace with each other for national reconciliation and cooperation and meet the interests common to the nation through solidarity and unity and joint actions.
					
					All the Koreans should resolutely condemn and frustrate the reckless military provocations and north-targeted war exercises of the bellicose forces at home and abroad and their moves to beef up their armed forces as they are seriously threatening the nation's security and peace.
					
					They should expose and denounce every move of the anti-reunification forces swimming against the trend of the times towards independent reunification, obsessed with the hostility towards fellow countrymen and escalate the struggle to foil them.
					
					The progressive patriotic forces in south Korea should firmly unite as one in order to intensify the struggle to put an end to the treacherous moves of the conservative group to escalate the inter-Korean confrontation and pursue fascism.
					
					The anti-reunification forces can never hold in check the Koreans' advance towards the independent reunification no matter how desperately they may work.

articles.title: KCNA Urges Japan to Settle Issue of Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
KCNA Urges Japan to Settle Issue of Sexual Slavery

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Two decades have passed since the issue of comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army was put on the agenda of discussion in international arena in 1991. It was a hideous sexual slavery enforced by the Japanese imperialists during their colonial military rule over Korea.
					
					However, Japan has not yet made any state apology and reparation to the victims.
					
					This is a mockery and challenge to the Korean people and world conscience calling for Japan's settlement of its past crimes.
					
					The above-said sexual slavery was an organized crime committed by the state of Japan and a hideous crime against humanity which allows no application of the statute of limitation. 
					
					According to the Constitution of the Japanese state, the then Japanese king had all state powers such as judicature, administration and legislation and the right to command the units of the Imperial Japanese Army dispatched overseas in his hand. He let the staff of the dispatched forces undertake the operations for abducting women of foreign countries and made sure that the Ministry of War issued instructions to carry them out if necessary. 
					
					According to the goals set by the military, women were abducted from Korea and other Asian countries en masse. 
					
					As the Japanese publication "King's army and Korean comfort women" said, the Japanese government and military mapped out a plan to ensure one comfort woman went round to every 29 soldiers of the Imperial Japanese Army and different kinds of laws and documents were adopted to implement it. 
					
					It was proved by wartime cables and documents that women were abducted by the order of the military. 
					
					This clearly tells that the Japanese king and its government and military which acted by his order and approval were the main culprit of the said sexual slavery. 
					
					Pursuant to the plan conceived by the state of Japan to satisfy the sexual greed of soldiers of the Imperial Army, operations for abducting women reminiscent of medieval slave-hunting were committed openly in Korea, turning it into a veritable hell threatened with abduction of women. 
					
					As many as 200 000 Korean women were drafted to the areas under the Japanese imperialists' occupation and those areas where their troops were stationed. 146 000 of them died in alien lands. 
					
					The above-said sexual slavery was the most despicable and cruel crime in human history as it was committed by the Japanese government, military, government-general in Korea and police under it. 
					
					Japanese politicians, however, are evading the responsibility to settle the Japanese imperialists' blood-stained history of Korean aggression and their sexual slavery and even whitewashing them, though they know well about the crimes. 
					
					They have made neither apology nor reparation for the sexual slavery but are totally denying and distorting the historical facts. 
					
					It is nearly a century since the issue of the comfort women surfaced and it is 20 years since the issue was brought up for discussion in international arena but this issue has not yet found any solution entirely due to the shameless attitude of Japan. 
					
					Japan's persistent denial of the above-said issue is aimed at covering up the crimes committed by the Imperial Japanese Army in the last century and evading the settlement of its past forever. 
					
					Japan's redressing of its past wrongs is not a matter which allows it to go without redeeming them. Because it is a matter which Japan should settle without fail weather the DPRK-Japan relations are improved or not and a political, moral and legal obligation it assumed before humankind and history.
					
					It is the view of the fair international public opinion that the Japanese government should make state reparation for the sexual slavery in a responsible manner.
					
					Japan has to fully open data on all the crimes committed against the Korean nation to the public and take urgent measures for fulfilling political, moral and legal responsibilities including formal apology and reparation.

articles.title: Action for Living of Handicapped Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Action for Living of Handicapped Declared in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Opposition parties and handicapped movement organizations in Pusan area of south Korea formed the Pusan Solidarity for Abolishing Discrimination against Handicapped at the plaza of the Pusan City Office on August 10.
					
					The declaration was read out at the inaugural ceremony. It deplored that the living of the handicapped in Pusan area is deteriorating due to the discriminating policy of the "government".
					
					The handicapped will wage a dynamic struggle for their genuine life, it stressed.
					
					It demanded the present authorities take a measure for equal wellbeing of the handicapped at an early date.

articles.title: Eradication of Pro-Japanese Remnants and Independent and Peaceful Reunification Demanded
articles.content:
Eradication of Pro-Japanese Remnants and Independent and Peaceful Reunification Demanded

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Kwon O Hon, honorary chairman of the Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy in south Korea, in an article on August 9 called for eradicating pro-Japanese remnants and achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					The article said:  On August 1 Dietmen from the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan arrived at Kimpho Airport of south Korea to visit Ullung Islet before kicking up a racket.  On August 2 the so-called "white paper on defense for 2011" calling for "dominium over Tok Islets" was adopted at the Cabinet meeting of Japan.
					
					Worse still, the Japanese government officially adopted the history textbook for secondary school in which the Pacific War is embellished as "a greater East Asia war."
					
					This is Japan's undisguised intrigue to revive militarism and an act of unhesitatingly revealing its ambition for reinvasion of the Korean Peninsula, it held.
					
					Japan is laying hurdles in inter-Korean dialogue by taking advantage of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK, far from making an apology and reparation of the crimes which brought so painful wounds to Koreans, it said.
					
					It is the task of the national history to eliminate pro-Japanese remnants and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, it noted, calling upon all the people to thoroughly shatter the policy for confrontation with fellow countrymen pursued in collusion with foreign forces, holding high the banner of the inter-Korean joint declarations with August 15 as an occasion.

articles.title: Actions for Checking Wrong Marking of East Sea of Korea Called for
articles.content:
Actions for Checking Wrong Marking of East Sea of Korea Called for

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- South Korean MBC on August 10 called for checking the moves of foreign forces to wrongly mark the East Sea of Korea.
					
					MBC accused the U.S. of recently submitting to an international organization a written view that the East Sea of Korea should be marked as "Japan Sea."
					
					The sea which the Korean nation has long called the East Sea of Korea was named "Japan Sea" because of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule over Korea in the past, it held.
					
					Any action to mark the East Sea of Korea as "Japan Sea" should be checked, it said, stressing that to this end the "government" should take positive measures.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted the full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Achieve the Great Unity of Our Nation" on the internet homepage on August 1.
					
					The work, published on August 1, Juche 80 (1991), clarified that the driving force for the country's reunification is the entire Korean nation and indicated the tasks and ways for achieving the great unity of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Colombia
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Colombia

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The Group for the Study of the Juche Idea "Kanggye" of Colombia issued a bulletin titled "Superb guerrilla war methods" on August 5 on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					Korea's liberation was a victory of the superb guerrilla war methods of Kim Il Sung as he created a lot of guerrilla war methods during the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle, it said.
					
					It introduced a battle fought during the Arduous March, noting that all tactics of the Japanese imperialists such as combing tactics, patience-wears-out-stones and long-distance pursuit tactics were thwarted due to Kim Il Sung's mysterious tactics so that many legends about his use of the art of compressing space were widely told among Koreans.
					
					The Pochonbo battle fought on June 4, 1937 also proved the outstanding military stratagem of Kim Il Sung who taught that the Korean people were not dead but alive and that if they fought against the Japanese imperialists, they would surely win. The significance of the battle was great indeed, it said, and continued:
					
					He won one victory after another in the battles fought during the great anti-Japanese war with ever-changing guerrilla war methods and achieved the historic cause of national liberation. These feats will always go down in the world history of national liberation struggle in colonies.

articles.title: Korea's Liberation Day Marked by Russian Political Party
articles.content:
Korea's Liberation Day Marked by Russian Political Party

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks of Russia posted a special write-up on its Internet homepage on August 6 on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation. It was interwoven with an article titled "August 15, 1945-Day of Korea's liberation" and a photo of the Arch of Triumph.
					
					It was President Kim Il Sung who led the arduous struggle of the Korean people to liberate the country usurped by the Japanese imperialists, the article said. 
					
					He formed the Down-with-Imperialism Union in his early years, founded the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army and waged the anti-Japanese armed struggle, it noted.
					
					The Pyongyang Mass Meeting was held on October 14, 1945 to welcome Kim Il Sung's triumphant return home, it said.
					
					The Arch of Triumph imposingly standing in Pyongyang conveys the feats performed by him for liberating Korea to posterity, it stressed.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Marked in Mexico, Bulgaria
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Marked in Mexico, Bulgaria

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Events were held in different countries to mark the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership. A seminar took place in Mexico and an opening ceremony of the Korean fine art exhibition in Bulgaria on August 6 and 8.
					
					The exhibition featured fine art works on the Korean people building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					Juan Campos Vega, chairman of the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, and other speakers highly praised Kim Jong Il as the great Songun brilliant commander as he has pursued the unique Songun politics by successfully carrying forward the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					Kim Jong Il's Songun politics serves as the most effective political mode and all-powerful treasured sword for shattering the imperialists' high-handed and arbitrary practices and ambition for world hegemony and guaranteeing the triumphant advance of the cause of popular masses for independence and the socialist cause, they said, explaining and proving the essence, validity and vitality of the Songun politics by linking it with the reality of the DPRK.
					
					Under the 50 odd year-long Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people have made great progress in the struggle to build a thriving nation, reunify the country and accomplish the cause of global independence, they stressed.
					
					They expressed the belief that the Korean people would grandly greet the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung as a great jubilee in human history under the experienced and seasoned leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Korean Song Popular among Chinese People
articles.content:
Korean Song Popular among Chinese People

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The Korean song "Worthwhile Job", which was written by Pak Yong Hwan and composed by Jon Chang Il, is a theme song of the feature film "The Flourishing Village" created in Juche 59 (1970). 
					
					The song is one of the Korean songs popular among Chinese people.
					
					The movie is based on a peasant family eliminating hangovers of old ideas after the completion of the agricultural cooperativization in Korea. Through the life of the family, the movie shows a Korean rural community undergoes great changes as required by the Theses on the Socialist Rural Question. 
					
					The song, full of national feelings, reflects a happy life enjoyed by the villagers, helping and leading each other forward and reaping rich harvests of crops under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					The song of cheerful melody is still favored by not only the Korean but Chinese people.
					
					Shenyang citizens in Liaoning Province, China re-wrote the song based on their life and call it "Song of Shenyang."

articles.title: U.S. Hit for Instigating Japan to Grab Tok Islets
articles.content:
U.S. Hit for Instigating Japan to Grab Tok Islets

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The deputy spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary on August 9 chided the base behavior of the U.S. imperialists to mark the inviolable sea of the Korean nation as "Japan Sea".
					
					Recalling that the U.S. submitted to an international organization an official view that the East Sea of Korea should be unilaterally marked as "Japan Sea," he said this base action is sparking off strong resentment of all the Koreans.
					
					The designation of "Japan Sea" contrary to the international common sense appeared for the first time at the U.S. tacit approval, he charged.
					
					The U.S. recent behavior is little short of a replica of the 1905 "Taft-Katsura Agreement" as it is instigating Japan to grab Tok Islets, it held.
					
					If the U.S. continues insisting on marking "Japan Sea", it will spark off bitterer anti-Americanism, it said, demanding the U.S. immediately withdraw the recent action and make an apology for it.

articles.title: Putin Calls for Railway Modernization
articles.content:
Putin Calls for Railway Modernization

					Moscow, August 12 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin said the well function of all chains of railway transport is one of prerequisites to healthy development of the Russian economy, enhancing of industrial potentials and implementation of the project for large-scale infrastructure. 
					
					He made the remark in a message he sent to railway workers on August 7 congratulating them on their holiday.
					
					What is important in creditably implementing the tasks for railway transport is to apply up-to-date technologies to railway transport, build new trunk lines and improve the railway service, the message said.

articles.title: Russian Air Force to Improve Its Equipment
articles.content:
Russian Air Force to Improve Its Equipment

					Moscow, August 12 (KCNA) -- Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Air Force Alexandr Delin Tuesday said Russia plans to increase the bases of army flying corps from 8 to 14 till 2020.
					
					Speaking to reporters, he said the air force will purchase over 1 000 helicopters until 2020 according to the state military equipment plan.
					
					Russia pays deep concern to resuming the manufacture of large transport helicopter "Mig-26" to provide the army with fuel and lubricant, he said, adding:
					
					The air force received four "Su-34" tactical bombers last year and will take six this year.
					
					The U.S. does not have such bomber.
					
					This year the air force will also receive anti-aircraft missiles "S-400" for two regiments.
					
					The Russian Defense Industry Complex is developing a new long-range early warning aircraft "A-100".
					
					Russia plans to deploy operational and tactical drones in air bases under the control of the headquarters of each military district.

articles.title: Russia Dismantles Half of Chemical Weapons
articles.content:
Russia Dismantles Half of Chemical Weapons

					Moscow, August 12 (KCNA) -- More than a half of chemical weapons have been dismantled in Russia.
					
					The dismantled weapons weigh 20 957 tonnes.
					
					The country plans to abolish all the remaining chemical weapons till 2015, said a news report.

articles.title: Russia Intensifies Missile Early Warning System
articles.content:
Russia Intensifies Missile Early Warning System

					Moscow, August 12 (KCNA) -- Russia is paying much effort to strengthening the missile early warning system.
					
					The Russian Space Force plans to build latest-type radar sets for the early warning system in Kaliningrad and Armabir regions in December this year and in Irkutsk Region in 2012.
					
					The radar sets will enable Russia to place the sky above border areas under its control again.

articles.title: Russia Will Strive to Preserve Arctic Nature: President
articles.content:
Russia Will Strive to Preserve Arctic Nature: President

					Moscow, August 12 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev recently sent a congratulatory message to an international meeting, expressing the willingness to steadily contribute to preserving the arctic nature. 
					
					The message said that the Arctic Region is affluent in useful mineral reserves and has the shortest sea route linking Europe and Asia. A stable development of the region based on mutual cooperation and unquestioned respect for international law is of special significance.
					
					Russia will as ever strive to preserve the rare nature of the region and implement international plans in the fields of transport and mining, the message stressed.

articles.title: Juvenile Science and Technology Competition Held in China
articles.content:
Juvenile Science and Technology Competition Held in China

					Beijing, August 12 (KCNA) -- The 26th Juvenile Science and Technology Innovation Competition took place in Huhehaote City, China, from August 4 to 7.
					
					The competition was attended by 461 schoolchildren and 195 scientific and technological supervisors from throughout the country.
					
					The competition was held on the theme "Innovation, experience and growth", divided into contest and exhibition activities.

articles.title: China Calls for Cooperation with UNESCO
articles.content:
China Calls for Cooperation with UNESCO

					Beijing, August 12 (KCNA) -- Chinese President Hu Jintao Thursday met the visiting general-director of the UN Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO), Irina Bokova, in Shenzhen City, Guangdong Province, and discussed the country's cooperation with the international organization.
					
					The president said UNESCO has done much creative work and played an important role in promoting education and developing science, technology and cultural traditions in many countries.
					
					China pays a top priority to cooperation with UNESCO and will support and join the organization in promoting all-people education and preserving the world's cultural and natural heritages, he added.

articles.title: U.S. Aircraft Enter Sri Lankan Airspace: Spokesperson
articles.content:
U.S. Aircraft Enter Sri Lankan Airspace: Spokesperson

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Sri Lankan air force spokesperson Andrew Wijesooriya at a press interview on Tuesday insisted that U.S. aircraft had entered the country's airspace.
					
					U.S. aircraft were picked up on Sri Lanka's radars, said the spokesperson.

articles.title: U.S. Branded as Hateful Country: Khamenei
articles.content:
U.S. Branded as Hateful Country: Khamenei

					Tehran, August 12 (KCNA) -- Seyed Ali Khamenei, leader of the Islamic Revolution of Iran, in a conversation on August 7 branded the U.S. as the hateful country for the Islamic countries.
					
					The U.S. has become the most unbelievable and hateful country in the region and the Islamic world due to its wrong foreign policy, he said.
					
					Hence, the hatred for the U.S. is growing day by day, he added.

articles.title: Cambodia Needs to Beef Up Defense Capacity: Minister
articles.content:
Cambodia Needs to Beef Up Defense Capacity: Minister

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted the full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Achieve the Great Unity of Our Nation" on the internet homepage on August 1.
					
					The work, published on August 1, Juche 80 (1991), clarified that the driving force for the country's reunification is the entire Korean nation and indicated the tasks and ways for achieving the great unity of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Nepal Improves Poor's Living Conditions
articles.content:
Nepal Improves Poor's Living Conditions

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Nepal has made a progress in improving the living conditions of the poor.
					
					The country's Central Bureau of Statistics on Monday announced that the income of the poorest 20 percent of the population increased nearly 4 times over the last seven years.

articles.title: Nepal Bans Smoking in Public Places
articles.content:
Nepal Bans Smoking in Public Places

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese government took a new measure to ban smoking in public places in the country from August 7.
					
					Government offices, restaurants, airports, libraries, hotels, department stores and other public places have been designated no-smoking zones.
					
					Anyone selling tobacco products to persons under the age of 18 years and pregnant women will be fined.
					
					The Act also prohibits advertising and sponsoring programs in the name of tobacco-related products through media.

articles.title: Israeli Army Arrests 11 Palestinians in West Bank
articles.content:
Israeli Army Arrests 11 Palestinians in West Bank

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The Israeli army is resorting to suppression of Palestinians despite the international community's protest and denunciation. 
					
					The Israeli army raided Hebron City in the West Bank on August 9 and arrested 11 innocent Palestinians.

articles.title: Jordan King Berates Israeli Settlements Expansion
articles.content:
Jordan King Berates Israeli Settlements Expansion

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- King Abdullah II of Jordan at the talks with Chief of the Palestinian National Authority Mahmoud Abbas on August 7 strongly denounced Israel for its moves to expand Jewish settlements.
					
					The continued Israeli settlement activities are illegal acts as they undermine international efforts to achieve the peace in the Mideast area, he said.
					
					He reiterated the stand of his country supporting the Palestinian people in their struggle to retake the usurped right and build an independent state.

articles.title: Australia's Consumer Confidence Falls 3.5 pct. in August
articles.content:
Australia's Consumer Confidence Falls 3.5 pct. in August

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Australia's consumer confidence fell in August, given the recent turbulence in global financial markets, latest survey showed on Wednesday.
					
					The Westpac-Melbourne Institute consumer confidence index, released on Wednesday, showed a 3.5 percent fall in August to 89.6 points, its lowest level since May 2009.

articles.title: Iran Discovers New Natural Gas Field
articles.content:
Iran Discovers New Natural Gas Field

					Tehran, August 12 (KCNA) --A new gas field containing around 495 billion cubic meters of natural gas and 658 million barrels of gas condensates, roughly valued 133 billion U.S. dollars has been discovered at Assalouyeh region in south Iran, the semi-official Mehr news agency reported on Monday.

articles.title: Ethiopian Red Cross Targets 165,000 Drought Victims for Relief
articles.content:
Ethiopian Red Cross Targets 165,000 Drought Victims for Relief

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian Red Cross Society said on Tuesday it has targeted 165,000 drought affected people for relief in the southeastern part of the Horn of Africa country. 
					
					Relief activities have been undertaken to supply drinking water and control epidemics of communicable diseases.

articles.title: Number of Jobless Japanese Increases
articles.content:
Number of Jobless Japanese Increases

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The number of people who have lost their jobs and become eligible for unemployment benefits since the March 11 earthquake and tsunami in the three hardest-hit prefectures of Japan totaled 144,568 as of the end of July, almost double the figure for the same period last year, local labor officials said Tuesday.

articles.title: World's Tallest Tower to Go up in Saudi in 5 Years
articles.content:
World's Tallest Tower to Go up in Saudi in 5 Years

					Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- A Saudi investment company plans to complete the world's tallest tower in just over five years time on the outskirts of the Red Sea city of Jiddah.
					
					The 1 000-meter high tower will cost $400 million.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop se reune con delegacion rusa
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop se reune con delegacion rusa

					Pyongyang, 13 de agosto (ACNC) -- El vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Yang Hyong Sop, departio este sabado en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion de Iglesia Ortodoxa de Rusia encabezada por Mark, arzobispo de Yegorievsk y presidente del comite de control de instituciones en ultramar, que le hizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: ACNC comenta atrocidades inhumanas de Japon
articles.content:
ACNC comenta atrocidades inhumanas de Japon

					Pyongyang, 13 de agosto (ACNC) -- Ya pasaron 20 anos desde cuando en 1991 se presento en la arena internacional el problema de ex consoladoras para el ejercito japones, crimenes esclavistas sexuales nunca vistos cometidos por los imperialistas japoneses durante su ocupacion militar colonial sobre Corea.  
					
					Pero, Japon no hace todavia ninguna disculpa estatal ni indemnizacion a las victimas del respecto, lo cual es una burla y desafio al pueblo coreano y a la conciencia mundial que demandan la liquidacion del pasado de Japon. 
					
					Estos son los crimenes organizativos del Estado japones y archi-crimenes anti-eticos sin prescripcion.
					
					El rey japones, que segun la constitucion japonesa de aquel entonces tomaba todo el poder del Estado incluyendo la judicatura, la administracion y la legislacion y el mando de los uniformados japoneses enviados al extranjero, hizo que el Estado Mayor de ejercito enviado al extranjero se encargara del secuestro de las mujeres de otros paises y lo ejecutara mediante la orden del Ministerio de las Fuerzas Terrestres segun la necesidad.
					
					Segun el proposito establecido por el circulo militar se realizaron en gran escala los secuestros de las mujeres en Corea y la region asiatica.
					
					Como senala el libro "El ejercito del rey y las consoladoras coreanas" editado en Japon, el gobierno y el circulo militar de este pais isleno trazaron el plan, segun el cual una consoladora sirviera para 29 militares japoneses y publicaron diversos decretos y documentos para ejecutarlo.
					
					Los telegramas y documentos del tiempo de guerra prueban que fueron cometidos los secuestros de las mujeres a ordenes de la capa militar.
					
					Todo esto muestra claramente que el gobierno y el circulo militar de Japon que siguieron  la orden y la firma del rey japones son autores de los crimenes alusivos a las ex consoladoras para el ejercito japones.
					
					Segun el plan inventado por el Estado japones para satisfacer la demanda sexual de los uniformados japoneses, se perpetraron abiertamente en Corea los secuestros de las mujeres como si fuera una caza medieval de esclavos y Corea se convirtio en un infierno de "entrega y secuestro de las mujeres".
					
					Mas de 200 mil coreanas fueron llevadas forzosamente a las regiones ocupadas por el imperialismo japones y a los lugares donde permanecian las unidades del ejercito japones y de entre ellas 146 mil coreanas perdieron sus vidas en las tierras foraneas.
					
					Tales crimenes son los viles y brutales inauditos en la historia de la humanidad perpetrados por el gobierno, el circulo militar, el gobierno general de Corea y hasta los policias pertenecientes  a este.
					
					No obstante, los politicos japoneses eluden la liquidacion del pasado criminal y lo embellecen, aunque conocen en detalles de la historia de agresion a Corea y dichos crimenes.
					
					Ellos no piden disculpas ni indemnizan sobre tales crimenes, sino niegan y tergiversan totalmente el mismo hecho historico.
					
					Japon niega obstinadamente el problema de ex consoladoras para el ejercito japones, lo cual reside en que trata de ocultar viles crimenes perpetrados por el ejercito japones del siglo pasado y evadir eternamente la liquidacion del pasado criminal.
					
					La liquidacion del pasado es el asunto de que Japon debe concluir sin falta porque es una obligacion politica, moral y juridica asumida ante la humanidad y la historia independientemente de que se mejoren o no las relaciones Corea-Japon.
					
					Ahora, la justa opinion publica internacional insiste en que el gobierno japones debe responsabilizarse de susodichos crimenes y hacer la indemnizacion estatal.
					
					Japon debe publicar oficialmente todos los datos referentes a los crimenes perpetrados contra la nacion coreana y tomar cuanto antes las medidas para ejecutar las responsabilidades politicas, morales y legales, entre otros, la disculpa oficial y la indemnizacion.

articles.title: Periodico de Coreanos en EE.UU. condena represion del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Periodico de Coreanos en EE.UU. condena represion del Sur de Corea

					Pyongyang, 13 de agosto (ACNC) -- El periodico de Internet de los Coreanos residentes en Estados Unidos "Minjok Thongsin" inserto el dia 8 el articulo intitulado "Represion a la 'Minjok 21' es el acto de traicion a la patria".
					
					La represion contra la revista surcoreana "Minjok 21" se cometio en el marco del acto dictatorial con que vino oprimiendo las actividades de prensa de las entidades civiles y sociales y hasta las de periodicos y radios, el articulo lo califica de un acto antinacional, antidemocratico y anti-reunificacion.
					
					La nota senala que despues de fundada esta revista hasta ahora, libro las actividades de prensa conforme a la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre, razon por la cual recibio el apoyo de toda la nacion.
					
					El "Poder", que reprime esta revista, es el grupo traidor a la patria anti-reunificacion.
					
					Todos los coreanos no deben tolerar la represion de las autoridades surcoreanas contra el medio de prensa por la reunificacion, finaliza.

articles.title: Reunificacion independiente promete futuro maravilloso de nacion coreana
articles.content:
Reunificacion independiente promete futuro maravilloso de nacion coreana

					Pyongyang, 13 de agosto (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual difundido este sabado, el diario Rodong Sinmun sostuvo que las actuales relaciones intercoreanas se hallan todavia en la peor fase debido a la politica conflictiva de las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					Con motivo del 15 de agosto (dia de liberacion de Corea), todos los coreanos deben hacer mas fuerte en escala pannacional el clima pro-reunificacion, con la fe en la victoria de la causa de reunificacion de la patria, comienza el articulista y continua:
					
					Los que desean la reunificacion del pais y la prosperidad de la nacion deben cumplir sus responsabilidades y mision, como integrantes de la nacion coreana, en la lucha por defender la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre y por implementarlas.
					
					Todos los coreanos tienen que fortalecer las fuerzas subjetivas a cargo de reunificacion uniendose bajo la bandera del ideal "Entre nosotros, los connacionales" y dejando a un lado las diferencias de ideas, regimenes, criterios politicos y doctrinas.
					
					Los partidos politicos, entidades y los compatriotas en el interior y exterior del pais deben apoyarse y coordinar sus acciones por la reconciliacion y cooperacion nacionales y satisfacer los intereses comunes de la nacion con la solidaridad, alianza y acciones conjuntas.
					
					Toda la nacion coreana ha de rechazar, detener y frustrar rotundamente las imprudentes provocaciones militares, las maniobras de guerra anti-RPDC y el aumento armamentista de las fuerzas belicistas internas y externas que amenazan gravemente la seguridad nacional y la paz.
					
					Deben intensificar la lucha por revelar y destruir cada maniobra de las fuerzas anti-reunificacion que cautivadas por la conciencia hostil a los connacionales, se oponen a la corriente de la epoca hacia la reunificacion independiente.
					
					Las fuerzas progresistas y patrioticas del Sur de Corea, unidas firmemente como un solo hombre, tienen que iniciar la lucha por poner punto final a los actos antinacionales de la banda de conservadores surcoreanos enfrascada en la confrontacion fratricida y el fascismo.
					
					Por muy desesperados que fueran los esfuerzos obstaculizadores de las fuerzas anti-reunificacion, no pararan nunca la marcha de los compatriotas hacia la reunificacion independiente.
